samOptiPro 0.1.0
  • Reference

Identify per-parameter bottlenecks (low ESS/s, low ESS/post-draw, long time-to-target)

Source: R/assess.R
grapes-or-or-grapes.Rd

Ranks parameters by:

  • CE (ESS/s): low is worse,

  • AE (ESS/post-draw): low is worse,

  • slow_node_time (seconds to reach ess_threshold at current CE): high is worse.

x %||% y

Arguments

samples

mcmc.list/mcmc/matrix/data.frame.

runtime_s

numeric(1) wall time in seconds.

ess_threshold

numeric(1) target ESS per parameter (default 1000).

sampler_params

character() optional vector of parameter names to keep (stochastic nodes with samplers).

rhat_threshold

numeric(1) kept for API symmetry (not used for ranking).

ess_per_s_min

numeric(1) optional CE threshold; flags params below it (0 = inactive).

Value

list(type="ok" or "degenerate_only", details=list(ce=..., ae=..., time=..., degenerate=...), per_param=..., summary=..., top3=data.frame)

Details

Degenerate parameters (non-finite or non-positive ESS, AE, or CE) are listed in degenerate and excluded from rankings.

If you pass sampler_params, results are restricted to those parameters (useful to exclude deterministic monitors and keep stochastic nodes with samplers only).
